segments.text: did you know that abortion is still illegal in many states in the USA ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: why ? I thought Americans were supposed to be more open than that .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: well , for many religious people , they believe that people who abort their babies are murderers .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: do you think most people in America believe that abortion is wrong ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: no , I think it's mostly the older generation who are against abortions .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: it's no wonder there are so many teenage pregnancies in America .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: religious people blame it on pre-marital sex , not on abortion being illegal .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: what do you think about abortion ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I personally would never want to have one , but I think that since a pregnancy can affect a woman's entire life , she should have the right to decide for herself .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: do you think the fathers should have some kind of say in the matter ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I know this is going to sound sexist , but I don't think that men should have to give their approval to the mothers of their children .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: why not ? It's their children , too .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: that may be true , but when a woman gets pregnant , it changes her life completely . Men can still carry on with their lives after the birth exactly as they did beforehand .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: that might be true , but I think men should have some kind of say in the matter .
segments.speaker: S2
